verses.plain: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, if thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

tokens.t: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend,
thou hast stricken thy hand with a stranger,

verses.plain: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

tokens.t: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth, thou art taken with the words of thy mouth.

verses.plain: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

tokens.t: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself, when thou art come into the hand of thy friend; go, humble thyself, and make sure thy friend.

verses.plain: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

tokens.t: Give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

verses.plain: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

tokens.t: Deliver thyself as a roe from the hand
, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.

verses.plain: ¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

tokens.t: ¶ Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consider her ways, and be wise:

verses.plain: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

tokens.t: Which having no guide, overseer, or ruler,

verses.plain: Provideth her meat in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

tokens.t: Provideth her meat in the summer,
gathereth her food in the harvest.

verses.plain: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

tokens.t: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou arise out of thy sleep?

verses.plain: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

tokens.t: a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

verses.plain: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

tokens.t: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth, and thy want as an armed man.

verses.plain: ¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

tokens.t: ¶ A naughty person, a wicked man, walketh with a froward mouth.

verses.plain: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

tokens.t: He winketh with his eyes, he speaketh with his feet, he teacheth with his fingers;

verses.plain: Frowardness is in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

tokens.t: Frowardness
in his heart, he deviseth mischief continually; he soweth discord.

verses.plain: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

tokens.t: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly; suddenly shall he be broken without remedy.

verses.plain: ¶ These six things doth the LORD hate: yea, seven are an abomination unto him:

tokens.t: ¶ These six
doth the
hate: yea, seven
an abomination unto him:

verses.plain: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

tokens.t: A proud look, a lying tongue, and hands that shed innocent blood,

verses.plain: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

tokens.t: An heart that deviseth wicked imaginations, feet that be swift in running to mischief,

verses.plain: A false witness that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

tokens.t: A false witness
speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

verses.plain: ¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

tokens.t: ¶ My son, keep thy father’s commandment, and forsake not the law of thy mother:

verses.plain: Bind them continually upon thine heart, and tie them about thy neck.

tokens.t: Bind them continually upon thine heart,
tie them about thy neck.

verses.plain: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

tokens.t: When thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall keep thee; and
thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

verses.plain: For the commandment is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:

tokens.t: For the commandment
a lamp; and the law
light; and reproofs of instruction
the way of life:

verses.plain: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

tokens.t: To keep thee from the evil woman, from the flattery of the tongue of a strange woman.

verses.plain: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

tokens.t: Lust not after her beauty in thine heart; neither let her take thee with her eyelids.

verses.plain: For by means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

tokens.t: For by means of a whorish woman
to a piece of bread: and the adulteress will hunt for the precious life.

verses.plain: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

tokens.t: Can a man take fire in his bosom, and his clothes not be burned?

verses.plain: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

tokens.t: Can one go upon hot coals, and his feet not be burned?

verses.plain: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

tokens.t: So he that goeth in to his neighbour’s wife; whosoever toucheth her shall not be innocent.

verses.plain: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

tokens.t: do not despise a thief, if he steal to satisfy his soul when he is hungry;

verses.plain: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

tokens.t: But
he be found, he shall restore sevenfold; he shall give all the substance of his house.

verses.plain: But whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he that doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

tokens.t: whoso committeth adultery with a woman lacketh understanding: he
doeth it destroyeth his own soul.

verses.plain: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

tokens.t: A wound and dishonour shall he get; and his reproach shall not be wiped away.

verses.plain: For jealousy is the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

tokens.t: For jealousy
the rage of a man: therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.

verses.plain: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

tokens.t: He will not regard any ransom; neither will he rest content, though thou givest many gifts.

footnotes.text: and make…: or, so shalt thou prevail with thy friend
of the…: or, of the strange tongue
the adulteress: Heb. the woman of a man, or, a man’s wife
He will…: Heb. He will not accept the face of any ransom
